chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Restitution is set at zero. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days time served.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (13 pages) commencing  OCTOBER 29, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties.  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Restitution is set at zero.
NO CONTACT with victim, Caresse A.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.

Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for trial today but parties have reached a resolution.
The court will take judicial notice of certified documents attached to complaint.
The state is unable to proceed as to counts 2 and 3 and moves to dismiss which is granted.
AS TO COUNT 1:  (REPEATER enhancer is deleted)   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant is remanded and sentencing adjourned to 10-29-2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Court grants State's motion and will allow other acts.
Case remains scheduled for trial in Branch 38.

Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-07-2015 at 08:15 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-28-2015 at 8:15 a.m.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests adjournment for trial.  Case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Caresse A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Laron Broshawn Johnson in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary Hearinng scheduled in Branch PE due DV Court is unavailable during the required time frame for the hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
